poem:
**A Meeting of Giants**

In the echo of boardrooms,  
countries dance, an exchange  
of shadows beneath polished  
tables. Words wrap around  
silk threads of trade; a needle  
sews promises thin as autumn  
leaves, rustling across oceans.  
The earth tilts slightly; man  
wrestles commerce, whispers  
bartered in global corridors.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US agrees commercial terms on TikTok sale, as Trump says China talks went ‘very well’ – business live 2.57pm BST US and China trade talks will resume in a month, treasury secretary Scott Bessent said after talks between both sides broke up in Madrid . The talks covered issues relating to critical raw materials, money laundering and illicit fentanyl trade. “We will be holding trade negotiations in about a month again at a different location,”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: US agrees commercial terms on TikTok sale, as Trump says China talks went ‘very well’ – business live 2.57pm BST US and China trade talks will resume in a month, treasury secretary Scott Bessent said after talks between both sides broke up in Madrid . The talks covered issues relating to critical raw materials, money laundering and illicit fentanyl trade. “We will be holding trade negotiations in about a month again at a different location,”
